story.storybody:
Chandigarh, Jun 1 (PTI) To recognise the contribution of people of state during Punjabi Suba struggle, Punjab Chief Minister Parkash Singh Badal today said families of those Punjabis who attained martyrdom or were jailed during this watershed movement will be felicitated.

A decision to this effect was taken by the Chief Minister and Deputy Chief Minister Sukhbir Singh Badal while presiding over a high level meeting to chalk out plan to organise a series of programmes to commemorate 50th anniversary of carving out of modern Punjab State after relentless struggle by Punjabis.

Presiding over the meeting, the Chief Minister said that modern day Punjab was a result of selfless and valiant struggle launched by Punjabis to have their distinct state.

He said Punjabi Suba agitation was a glorious chapter in history of state as 43 people attained martyrdom and more than 55,000 courted arrest.

He said that this month long celebrations from October 1 to November 1 (Punjab Day) would be a "humble and befitting tribute to those unsung heroes who had taken part in this relentless struggle".

He said a suitable memorial for these heroes would be constructed at Amritsar so that people could pay tribute to them.

Badal said that a state-level function would be held at Amritsar on November 1 in which prominent Punjabis from different walks of life across the globe would be invited.

Sukhbir said the sole motive of organising this series of functions was to apprise the youngsters about the rich legacy of the state and its people. PTI VJ SMN
story.shortheadline: Punjab to felicitate families of Punjabi Suba Movement heroes
story.storytitle: Punjab to felicitate families of Punjabi Suba Movement heroes
